inn1.comm: is he trapped in front? First ball, it was an inswinger, landed just outside off and nipped back in, struck on the back pad as Taylor tried to close the face on that one. The umpire's given it out, Taylor's called for the referral. No impact with the bat, replays suggest it would have hit middle. The initial decision is upheld, Canada draw first blood
lands on a good length outside off, no shape there, held its line, left alone to the keeper
swinging in this time, gets across does Taibu, risky there, manages to just work it behind square, a thick inside edge
in that channel outside off, a hint of away movement, left alone to the keeper
short of a good length and moves back in sharply, caught the batsman by surprise there as he stepped back to whip it through midwicket, caught him on the pads, would have gone over the stumps
goodish length on middle, swinging in again, impressive stuff here, driven back with a straight bat to the bowler
gentle medium on the pads, Taibu perhaps missed an opportunity there, tried to clip it fine but couldn't get his bat to it
bowls it on a good length on the off, steps forward and pushes it wide of mid-off for a single
took it from middle, straight delivery from Baidwan, turned away off the front foot through square leg for a couple of runs
short of a good length on middle and off, rocks back does the bespectacled Coventry and punches it back
whipped away, he's an attacking batsman, it swung in and he swiped it wide of fine leg for a couple more
shortish on the off, rocks on the back foot and knocks it towards point
in the corridor outside off again, fullish and trying to tempt him to drive but it's left alone
angling in from wide of the crease, on a good length, gets a big stride out and defends it to cover
darts in from a good length, Taibu initially is tempted to play it but then withdraws as it moves back in
lands on a length on the off stump, pushed through the line to mid-off
short ball down the leg side, called a wide as it went further down
short of a good length on the off, nipping in, defended into the off side
some width there, short of a good length, left alone to the keeper
came back in from outside off, pushed into the off side towards cover

swinging across the line is Coventry, poor choice of shot, on middle and leg and a hint of inswing, Coventry tried to flick it over square leg, missed and was trapped in front of leg. Didn't ask for the referral there. He consulted with Taibu who told him he was out, and that he surely was. Charles keeps us waiting, his post-194 form remains unsatisfactory
banged in short, on middle, a bouncer but an unthreatening one
good start to his innings, was offered a bit of width, landed full and he just eased into it, driving it past mid-off for a boundary
short of a good length on the off, punched it wide of point, an attempt at the non-striker's end, ricochets off the bat but Ervine doesn't take the extra run
short of a good length outside off, steps back to punch it through cover, misses
goodish length on middle, gets forward and plays it solidly back down the pitch
swinging away from the left-hander, in the channel outside off, Ervine lets it go
full delivery on the pads, Ervine will feel he missed out there, turned away to short fine leg
gets on the front foot and opens the face this time to guide it down to third man for a single
lovely timing from Taibu, pitched it up and he drove it elegantly past a diving cover, came off the meat but slowed down in the outfield, it's a big ground this
banged in short outside off and it's pulled and pulled well, down to deep square leg for a single
slower one bowled short on middle, gets on the back foot and drops it into the leg side
goodish length just a fraction outside off, gets forward and taps it towards cover
a length ball outside off, in the zone to drive but Ervine, cautious early on, lets it be
gets on the front foot, short of a good length, runs it down to third man for a single
shortish outside off, gets on the back foot, opens the face and guides it to third man
fullish delivery outside off stump, these two are taking their time in these nervy few overs, left alone
angling in towards off, gets across, dabs it in front of midwicket and steals a quick single, and dives just to make sure
pretty accurate stuff, attacking the stumps, around middle and off, defended towards mid-off
the TV speedgun says 133kmph, full outside off, a flowing drive from Ervine but straight to extra cover
a gully in place and he comes into the act, short of a good length outside off, played behind square on the off side, gully intercepts and prevents the single
lucky there, short of a good length, rises up nicely, gets back and plays it uppishly wide of gully, down to third man where there's a fumble and they pick up a couple
Taibu takes full advantage of that flighted delivery that lands full, caressed through the off side past the covers
flatter and alters his length, holding it back, turn, just a bit, plays it down to midwicket
quicker through the air but misdirected, short ball outside leg stump, he just helps it on its way past short fine leg
turning in from the off, pushed away past midwicket for a single
round the wicket to the left-hander, bowled full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on for a single
pitched up on middle, pushed down the ground again
still some movement left in the pitch, Chohan gets it to move away from the right-hander, left alone
shortish on the off, gets on the back foot and plays it to cover
full outside off, third man is squarer than usual, slices it down towards him for a single
sweet sound of bat hitting ball, pitched up and he crunched it towards cover but Surkari dived to his right to prevent at least a couple of runs
short of a good length on middle, nipping in just a hint, gets across, turns the face and defends it into the leg side
nicely driven again, gets to the pitch and offers the full face but hit straight to extra cover
pitched up outside off and he goes after him, over the top this time, smacks it with an open face over the covers
as he did in the last over, Hansra held that one back, defended towards cover
quick single, gets forward and drops it in front of cover, a nod was all that was needed
fetches it from outside off, round the wicket, paddles it down to short fine for a single
slightly short outside off, turns in, dabs it towards short third man
A lapse in the field by Chohan, the spinner's leaking runs here and helping ease the pressure, shortish on leg stump, turned fine and Chohan at short fine dives over the ball, letting it through
goodish length on middle, will he bowl out? Steps forward and taps it towards cover
struck really hard, pitched up and it came off the meat but he found the felder at cover, who now runs back into the deep
full on middle, he's overstepped, a rare bowling lapse there from Chohan, turned to midwicket
full and almost yorker length, there wasnn't much Ervine could do about that except dig it out towards mid-on for a single
edged and four, short of a good length and a hint of away movement, tried to open the face, probably was thinking of running it down to third man, got a thick edge past the keeper
superbly fielded off his own bowling, driven back and Chohan throws himself to his right to stop that
slower one bowled short on middle, the offcutter, run down to third man for a single
on middle and leg, turned away past square leg for a well-run couple, the fielder was a little deep
fullish on the off, gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler
short of a good length on the off, gets an inside edge onto the thighs as he comes forward to defend
poor delivery, dropped it way too short on middle, was dispatched past short fine leg for an easy boundary
round the wicket to the left-hander, slower one bowled short, placed to third man
slower one again, dibbly dobblies here, played back to the bowler
short of a good length outside off, chopped down towards point
slower ball pitched up on the off, drilled through the covers into the deep for a single
a deceptive grunt as he bowls that, taps it towards third man for one more
lovely fielding by Nitish Kumar at backward point, cut away hard but he flings himself to his left to stop that
they're running well are these two, short ball on the off, writstily turned away past midwicket for a quick single
there is a deep cover in place, good length and he eases it into the deep
slower ball, the offcutter again, gets forward and guides it to point
targeting the off stump, punched towards extra cover
bowled it short on middle, moved back to play it towards point
shortish on middle, chops it towards point, the end of a tidy over
Taibu takes the aerial route, as they say it, a risky shot given that there is a deep cover in place, gets to that fielder on the bounce
waits for it to come on to the bat, played down to third man for a single
short on middle, gets on the back foot and punches it to mid-on
nicely done, found the gap there, there is a deep cover and a third man, it was short and wide and he cut it over point to beat the two
over the top again and this time over mid-off, pitched up, it's in the zone and he clears the in-field comfortably, lovely loft, a fifty's on the way
there it is, shortish, cutting back in, drops it behind point for a single to raise the fifty, his 17th in ODIs
goes for the sweep immediately, took forever to get to him, gets an inside edge onto the pads
has shaped himself up for the sweep there, Rao bowled it wide, chopped it down to point
looping it towards middle and off, gets forward and defends it to extra cover
slightly short on middle, gets forward and jabs it through square leg for a couple of runs, the field is spread out
short ball, turning away, Taibu's tempted, rocks back and absolutely slaps that but straight towards deep cover
how did that miss? Turned more than he expected, spun in from outside off and went through his defence, only missing off stump by a whisker
goodish length delivery on the off, driven down to long-off for a single
angling in towards middle, fullish, driven back past the bowler to beat mid-on, well timed, long-off runs across to cut it off, a couple of runs
gets forward and drops it wide of point to steal a run
stopped on him a little there, struck him high on the bat and lobbed up after it was dropped a little short
pushed down towards long-off for a single
hurled it full on the off, dug out towards extra cover
giving it a bit of air, steps forward and defends it into the off side
shortish on the off, gets on the back foot and punches it to deep cover
full toss on middle, sweeps it down to deep square leg
gets forward and pushes it towards cover
really slow through the air, swept down towards deep square leg for a single
didn't turn, went straight on, Ervine went for a hard sweep and missed, expecting it to turn in
tossed up and bowled full outside off, pushed past point for a single
angling in on leg stump, closes the face on that one and works it past midwicket, a bit of hesitation between the two there but all' well in the end
lands full outside off, driven through extra cover into the deep for a couple of runs
a bit of width there, sliced it past point for a single
tried to sweep that hard, fetched it from middle and off, got a bit of a top edge there but it evaded short fine leg by a distance, three runs in the end as it's hauled in by deep square leg
dabbed away into the off side
full toss by Rao, Ervine came down the track and swiped it past short fine, didn't connect it well enough, just a couple in the end
missed out again, another full toss, slapped it straight to deep square leg
poor bowling from Rao, short ball outside off, Taibu rocks back and pulls it hard past midwicket for three more
connected really well, took it from outside off, flatter from Rao and it's hammered through midwicket to beat the gap in the deep
pitched up on the off, just pushed through straight to extra cover
short ball outside off, waiting for it to turn in, cut down towards point
pushed it off the front foot towards extra cover
rocked back, waited for it to turn in, dropped it in front of point
comes down the track and drives it down to long-off
pushed away past cover for one more
firing it towards middle and off, played towards cover
clears the ropes, he's good with that sweep, fullish and he slog-sweeps it over the deep midwicket boundary, raises the 100 stand, an excellent effort after the openers were out in quick succession

Appeal for lbw, was a full toss and Taibu came forward to sweep that past square, struck on the pads, was given out by Asad Rauf. However, Taibu knows he's made contact with the bat there, he's called for a referral and replays show there was a big inside edge
out comes the slog-sweep, over midwicket for a couple of more runs
short ball outside off, cut away down past point for a couple of runs, the runs are flowing well
short of a good length, gets back and cuts it past point again, there's a fumble in the deep that allows them to get back for the second
nudged away into the leg side for a single
pitched up on the off, tries to drive through the line, gets a thick inside edge towards midwicket
the reverse-sweep, pitched on the leg stump, he had eyed his gap and placed it perfectly, past point for a boundary
goes for the sweep this time, gets a top edge towards deep square leg, but on the bounce
slightly short on the off, gets on the back foot and punches it towards cover
flat on middle, driven down the ground to long-on for a single
bowling it flat, comes down the track and drives it down to long-off to keep the strike
he continues to struggle, down the leg side and all Ervine has to do is tap it on the head, well placed, beats short fine leg for a boundary
a half-century for Ervine as he drives it past midwicket, his second fifty in ODIs, he's helped put Zimbabwe ahead here
low full toss outside off, Taibu reaches for it and slices it past point for a single
flighted outside off, driven down the ground to long-off
shortish, gets on the back foot and punches it pas tthe bowler, midwicket fumbles and allows them a single
nudged behind square towards short fine leg for a single
clean strike over the bowler's head, gave Davison the charge, it wasn't particularly flighted but he came down the track and got to the pitch, elegantly done as he lofted past the ropes
two more as it's played down the ground
short ball outside off, cut away towards deep point for  a single
tossed up outside off, driven down towards ;long-off for a single
flat on the off, pushed past extra cover for a single
flighted outside off, eased wide of point for a single
terrible delivery that gets the treatment, full toss and it's punished through extra cover, a yawning gap in the deep and it beats that
fires it on middle and leg, turned away wide of midwicket for a single
Hansra has had a horrible time with the ball today, round the wicket and bowls it on the pads, Ervine loves to sweep and he finds the fine-leg boundary without any difficulty
raises the 150-stand as he just nudges it past cover for a single
slightly short on middle, tickled past square leg for a single
short outside off, cut down towards point
low full toss on middle, driven hard back to the bowler
pitched it up on middle, hit it back down the ground towards long-on
the runs continue to bleed, down the leg side, a rare lapse by Chohan, Ervine just tickles it down to the fine-leg boundary
short of a good length outside off, gets across and turns it past square leg
pitches it up on the off, driven firmly wide of long-off for a couple of runs
full toss on middle, driven down to long-on for a single
short of a good length outside off, punched off the back foot to extra cover
shortish outside off, gets forward, opens the face and plays it wide of deep point
full toss on the off, pushed uppishly back past the bowler to long-off
they're running well these two, pushed past extra cover into the deep for two more
a high full toss from Cheema, played down to midwicket
yorker on middle, dug out past the bowler towards long-off for a single
shortish on the off, punched off the back foot towards deep cover
short of a good length on the off, the bat turns in his hand as he tries to punch it through the off side, goes to midwicket
short of a good length, guided down towards point
pushed gently down the ground, long-off is pretty deep and they have enough time to come back for the second
piercing the gaps with ease are these two, short of a good length, cut past point and Gunasekera does well in the deep, diving to his left and hauling it back in
low full toss on middle, driven down the ground to long-on
pushed it in the direction of cover for a single
angling it towards middle, played down to extra cover
short of a ball outside off, punched down towards deep cover for a single
off the meat, down the ground to long-off for a single
slower ball bowled short outside off, turned it past midwicket for a single
slower one, the offcutter, drops it in front of cover
playing a lot in the V, driven down to long-off
short of a good length outside off, cracked off the back foot to extra cover
closes the face to play it in front of midwicket
unable to restrain these two batsmen are Canada, singles are easy to come by, played down to long-on
shortish on the off, punched off the back foot to deep cover to keep strike
swept down towards deep square leg for a single
Partnership broken, spun back in from outside off, Ervine was just looking to defend it, there was a hint of extra bounce, got an inside edge onto the pads and it popped up, Bagai made no mistake
some turn again, spinning away, gets outside the line and drops it into the off side
pitched up on the off, driven back to the bowler who fumbles but no single on offer there
misdireced this time, down the leg side and Chigumbura sweeps it down to the fine-leg boundary
short ball outside off, cut away off the back foot to deep point
Cheema bowls that full on the off, played back to the bowler
yorker on middle, it swung in, Chigumbura digs it out but whacks his foot with the bat in the process and is in some pain
good length outside off, tries to drive through the line, gets a thick inside edge towards midwicket

Bagai's been excellent behind the stumps, Canada are trying to claw their way back in now, nipped back in from a good length, gets forward to defend, gets an inside edge onto the pads and Bagai dives forward to clasp it on the pitch
Cheema doles out a full toss first up, it's cracked past cover into the deep for a single
nice yorker there, right on middle, Taibu digs it out to cover
short ball, turning in, Williams gets back and cuts it down to deep point
Taibu steps forward, bends down and sweeps it past square leg for a single
These Zimbabweans love to sweep, Williams fetches that from the off stump and plays it with the turn through square for a boundary, raises the 200
floating it on middle, short ball, rocks back, turns it to midwicket
fires it full on the off, dragged towards deep square leg for one more

Oh Taibu, what have you done? Three quick wickets and the Canadians are back, tossed up outside off and Taibu went for the slog-sweep, not a wholehearted one though, got the top edge as he went against the turn and holed out to deep midwicket who's standing several yards in
full toss on middle, driven down to long-on for a single
flattish delivery, waiting for it to turn in, played to midwicket
opens the face at the last moment to play it down to short third
slapped off the back foot past extra cover for a single
fires it short outside off, reaches to cut it but can't quite connect
quicker through the air, full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
floating it on middle, gets forward to dab it down to midwicket
fortunate there, the turn helping him there, it spun away sharply, looked to chop it towards point, got the under edge, much finer than he had intended, beat short third to the boundary
pitched up outside off, driven hard towards deep cover for a single
short ball outside off, backs away and cracks it to deep point
floating it on middle and off, defended towards extra cover
flighted on middle, tickled past midwicket, the man in the deep is slow to get to it and they've stolen a couple by then
on leg stump, chipped past the bowler for a single
low full toss on the off, struck down towards long-on for a single
fires it well outside off stump, mistimes a drive to extra cover
slightly short on leg stump, turns in towards middle, pushed back to the bowler
slightly short, punched off the back foot past extra cover for a single
tidy over, keeps it flat, pushed back to Davison
full toss on middle, slapped down towards deep square leg where Nitish Kumar does a good job diving to his right
quick single, played wide of the bowler, Rao collects and aims at the stumps at the non-striker's end, misses, would have been a close call
nurdled for a single
gone, Rao's on a roll. A touch fortunate for the bowler there as Lamb dragged that one on, it spun away from the off stump, Lamb attempted the cut, got an inside edge onto the stumps, six down now
flat delivery on the off, gets forward and taps it towards cover
tossed up on middle and leg, turned towards midwicket
comes down the track to get to the pitch, drives it down to deep midwicket for a single
turning in from outside off, gets back and pushes it to midwicket
slightly short on the off, punches it to extra cover
short on middle, pulled away past square leg into the deep, Gunasekera fumbles and enables them to run back for the second
pushed through towards midwicket
steps back and punches it to extra cover
the googly there, but also a long hop, short and wide, turned away, gave Williams even more room and he thwacked it through extra cover
tossed up on the off, plays it to midwicket
a couple more, short ball, chopped past point for a couple of runs
on middle and leg, whipped through square leg for a single
pushed off the front foot towards cover
fires it flat outside off, struck hard towards deep cover
short on the off, gets on the back foot and punches it past the bowler to long-off
four more, no surprises, it's the sweep again, bisects the gap between deep square leg and deep midwicket, struck fiercely
pitches it on middle, pushed down to long-on for a single
tossed up outside off, drilled down to long-on
low full toss on middle, dragged towards deep midwicket for a single
short of a good length, rocks back and cuts it through point for a single
looping it on middle and off, defended towards extra cover
short on middle, made room and slashed it through point into the deep for a single

Bagai's into the act again, and so is Rao. Another important wicket just as Zimbabwe were stepping up, a ball bowled down the leg side, not particularly deserving of a wicket, Williams was looking to sweep it fine as ill-luck would have it, it went off the back of the bat straight into Bagai's gloves
short ball on the off, punched towards extra cover
flighted on middle, gets across and nudges it in front of square leg for a single
strays on the pads and it's flicked through square leg for a single
pushed through towards long-on for a single
slower one bowled short on middle, punched off the back foot to midwicket
low full toss on the off, driven down to long-off for a single
the offcutter, gets forward and pushes it towards cover
stopped on him a little and cut back in, tried to punch it into the leg side, got an inside edge onto his pads
short ball on middle, pulled towards deep square leg for a single
swung away towards short fine, sharp fielding but equally good running, thy've pinched a single
slower one bowled short on middle, turned away through square leg
low full toss, he's found the gap and taken the score past 250, driven along the ground in that big gap between deep midwicket and deep square leg
pitched up on the off, pushed down the ground to long-off
fires it full on the off again, drives it back to the bowler
an inswinging low full toss, struck to midwicket, there's a fumble and a resultant single
slower one bowled short outside off, dropped it wide of point for a single
plenty of width, bowled full as well, driven straight to extra cover
slightly short on the off, gets back and pushes it back to the bowler
had shaped up to play the paddle, it was wider than he would have liked but played it well, to deep square leg for a single
full and wide, got an under-edge as he reached for it, Bagai missed and they stole a single
full toss on middle, played down towards long-off for a single
appeal for lbw, tries to play the scoop but was struck outside th eline of off there, they steal a leg bye
aiming for the yorker, squeezed it towards point for a quick single
the scoop works this time, fetches it from the off stump, he had made his mind up, pitched on a length, just about right to execute that shot and beat short fine leg
appeal for lbw, but it went off the bat, trying to play the reverse-scoop this time, gets the edge and it goes down to fine leg, the bowler didn't know what happened
slower ball bowled short on middle, slapped over the bowler's head for a couple of runs
straying on the pads, swung down to fine leg for a single
dropped, didn't pick the slower one, tried to drag it over midwicket, mistimed it and Nitish Kumar, inside the circle, dived full length to his left but couldn't quite hold on
firmly struck, short ball outside off, he swatted it over the bowler's head to beat the fielders in the V
full on the pads, poor line and Cremer scoops it past short fine, they're making good use of the Powerplay here
round the wicket, tries aiming at the blockhole, played uppishly towards long-on for a single
slower one bowled full on middle, comes down the track and drills it down the ground wide of long-on
Chohan bangs it short and Cremer wasn't expecting it, tried to pull it but was late on the shot
yorker length outside off, Cremer can't quite squeeze it out there, had to reach a little for it
tried to scoop it fine, didn't quite time it well, got to the short fine fielder on the bounce, just the single
Utseya struck that well but holed out to deep square leg, length delivery and he picked it up well but found Jimmy Hansra perfectly positioned in the deep, he ran in a few yards and judged it well
Cremer continues to be positive, pitched up and he drives it well wide of long-off for a single
an inswinging yorker, dug out towards midwicket by the new man
slower one bowled on middle and leg, tries to swing it over midwicket, it's a bit of a miscue but lands safe, a couple more

the offcutter by Baidwan does the trick, Cremer had made room there and was targeting the straight boundary, tried to hit through the line, got an edge that flicked leg stump, nine down now with 10 Powerplay balls left. They wouldn't want to waste it. Handy knock by Cremer, though
full outside off, just pushes at it, doesn't make contact

a belated appeal from the bowler as Mpofu is struck on the pads while trying to close the face, appearing to strike him in line with leg but that's only on first sight. Replays indicate that the ball would have gone down leg. They've called for a referral after the umpire turned down the appeal
banged it short on leg stump, an attempted bouncer, Price ducks under it
absolutely whacked it, short ball on middle and he dispatched it to the square-leg boundary
Mpofy digs out the yorker into the leg side and Price calls for the single, making it in time, he's the right man to be on strike for Zimbabwe
another inswinging yorker, Price is fortunate to get some bat to it, it drops dead on the pitch and they steal another quick single
full toss on the off, pushed gently to mid-off for one more
Lovely stuff from Price, inspired by Dougie Marillier, low full toss on middle, attempted yorker gone wrong, moves across and scoops it past short fine
tried it again and could have worked but for his leg, it was a full toss and he played it onto his leg as he tried that shot again, just the single this time
low full toss, tapped towards point for a single

inn2.comm: back of a length to star off with, punched to cover, crisp sound off the bat
slightly fuller, slightly straighter, no movement, true bounce, defended back to Mpofu
nice punch shot again, off the front foot, straight to cover
lucky, is Mpofu. Strays on the pads with the fine leg up, but Davison plays it straight to the man
another leg-side offering wasted through a flick straight to mid-on
short ball, tennis-ball bounce, Davison ducks under it. Umpire says the height is fine. Maiden over
Nitish gets off the mark first ball. Soft hands, bunted into the leg side, and runs through
flat delivery, defended back to Price

Price strikes. What a performer for Zimbabwe, regularly opens the bowling, and hardly ever disappoints. Davison gives him the charge here, and plays down the wrong line of a flighted delivery that straightens ever so little. Enough to take the top of off. The bail hits the keeper in the throat
flat delivery, just short of a length, defended back
fuller, stump to stump, defended again
another forward-defensive
Nitish looks to drop and run, but it's gone straight to backward point, and he is sent back
slower ball, Kumar plays in front of his body, bat turns in the hand, and it rolls back to the bowler
looks to drive, planting the front foot down, gets the inside half of the bat, back to the bowler
short delivery, looking to tuck him, is wided down the leg side
looking for the pull shot, loose shot, and is beaten
push-drive, good connection, but can't find the gap at cover
angling into the pads, worked away, but finds square leg
stump to stump again, back of a length, defended back
fullish on the pads, turned to square leg
flighted this time, no turn, defended back again
full delivery, pushed back again
stays back to the in-between length, gets an inside edge onto the pads
Price is livid, he is kicking away as he goes back to his mark. Why? Because he has conceded a single. Bowled on the pads, and Gunasekara turns it past midwicket
prefers pace to spin. This is the first ball he has faced from Mpofu, and rocks back to a short delivery to pull it through midwicket. All along the ground
fuller this time, Gunasekara comes forward to pat it back to Mpofu
left alone outside off
left alone outside off again. Covered his stumps before he shouldered arms
fuller, gets right behind it, and pushes it to mid-on
defended towards cover-point, good comeback from Mpofu after having been hit for four first ball
turn there, very little, though, but enough to get a leading edge from Kumar who stays back. it falls safe, however
flat, into the pads, turned to square leg

Price sticks his left hand out and sends back Kumar. He slowed this one down, inviting the drive, Kumar got inside the line, and looked to go towards mid-off, playing half a second too early, and chipping it to the left of Price. No great pace on the ball, and Price takes a good one-handed catch

Price is on a hat-trick. And what an ordinary way to get out for the captain. It seemed Bagai had decided yesterday he would sweep Price the first ball he faces him. He does. And the ball is slightly shorter than he wants, and there is a touch extra bounce, and the tame top edge is pouched at square leg
Slow, loopy, teasing. The slowest he has bowled ever? 79ks. Hansra resists the temptation of reaching out, stays back, lets it turn and then defends
slow and loopy again, this time Hansra stretches forward to defend
driven to mid-off, can't find the gap
full and wide, and left alone
slower ball, grips from the surface, but Gunasekara doesn't commit to a shot, and defends it well
good-looking drive, but finds mid-off again
forward defensive - 16 deliveries without a run now, and two wickets lost in the process
finally a run, slower ball, on the pads, turned away to long leg for one
defends around the front pad, towards straight midwicket
flighted delivery, pushed back to him
tossed up again, pitches middle and off, gets turn, played uppishly towards square leg
flat and quick again, played back
forward defensive to cover
arm ball, good thing that Gunasekara has shut shop and is not looking to score runs, which allows him to play this late and not commit to any shot early
pushed nicely, between mid-off and mid-on, gets the single
defends around the front pad again, which he often tends to do
driven nicely, but still can't pierce the cover field. Just the single there
good bouncers, gets a bit big on him, on target too, Hansra fends, but it falls short of short midwicket
slower ball, outside off, pushed to cover
another good bouncer, and Mpofu is unlucky again. Hansra is clearly late into the pull, but gets a chunky top edge, which clears the keeper and slips by a comfortable distance
full and fast, defended
same control again, and Price does the fielding again, and rushes back to his mark
slower through the air, draws him out, almost overbalances as he looks to defend
some more loop, and sharp turn too, turned to short fine leg
flatter this time, defended back
slightly slower than the last one, Gunasekara defends off the front foot
quick, accurate delivery, keeps it out
now he flights it up, Hansra steps out of his crease and defends
tossed up wide outside off again, defended back
slightly flatter, almost a yorker outside off, played back to him
invitingly tossed up again, pushed back to the bowler who lets a throw rip back to the keeper
almost gets the wicket with that flight, this time getting Hansra to play in the air towards long-on, but it doesn't quite carry to the fielder
on off stumps again, can't get this away
fired into the pads, misses out on the offering
Stop the press! They have finally scored off Price. Slower through the air this time, turned away to square leg for one
Gunasekara defends again
Boundary off Price! Doomsday has arrived. Good shot, really nice shot, charges at a flighted delivery, and chips it over midwicket

well well well, four overthrows off the bowling off Price. Somebody gonna get a-hurt real bad. Coventry it is this time. This was pushed to mid-off for a sharp single, Coventry threw wide of the keeper and slip. Don't go anywhere near Price, Charles
offbreak around off, defended

classical offspinners's one-two. Offbreak followed by the straighter one, Gunasekara plays for the turn, is hit on the pad, Asad Rauf thinks he is gone lbw, but Gunasekara goes for the review. And what does it reveal? That he had got just outside the line of off by the time the ball hit his pad. The decision is reversed
full delivery, driven to long-off for one

that's how they need to bat! No half-hearted chip. He accepts the invitation from this flighted delivery, comes down the track, right to the pitch of the ball, and goes way over long-off. Sweet timing
flat into the pads, turned away for a single
flighted around middle and leg, defended back to Utseya
looks to help it away with the angle for one, can't beat short fine leg
darts this one into the pads, cramping him up
slower, much slower, turning away, Hansra goes deep into the crease and defends
slightly quicker, pushed to midwicket
fuller, flatter, defended to leg
fired into the pads for another dot. Maiden from Price. All's well with the world again
shimmies down the track to push this to long-on for one
yorks himself, digs this delivery out to to short third
flighted outside off, defended with an open face
full and accurate, pushed back to Utseya
loose delivery, shortish and wide, cut away, but straight to point
overpitched, gets a single into the on side
loosener, short and wide, but Hansra can't beat short third man, the only cover there
closer to the stumps, fuller too, defended back
chipped towards long-on for one
wide down the leg side
gets it right this time, Gunasekara comes forward and defends
a bit leg-sidish, but not damage done
slight misfield by Utseya at extra cover gives away the single
sharp turn from middle and leg, gets an edge but it falls safe
comes down the track to defend this one
trying to pat a burning down, trying to cut the straighter one, and is lucky that he has not chopped this onto his stumps
pre-meditated sweep for one
flighted on middle and leg, generously tossed up, there is turn to, does well to defend it back to him
draws him out of the crease, pushed to mid-off
flat offbreak, defended back
wide down the leg side
plays in front of his body, uppishly too, but it falls short of extra cover
another wide down the leg side
looks to make room, Lamb follows him, cramping him up
driven down to long-on this time
swept to short fine, there is yes and no, and no prevails eventually
short, cut away to sweeper-cover
flat offbreak, defended to cover
tossed up, pushed to midwicket
gets inside the line and turns this offbreak into the leg side for one
another wide down the leg side. Zimbabwe have been a bit loose of late

appeal for leg-before, but pitching middle and leg and not turning. So going down, but wait, Zimbabwe have gone for the UDRS. The replays show that while it is not missing the leg stump, but less than half ball is hitting it, so Rauf's instinct was correct this time
comes down the track, pushes it to long-on for one
flat delivery, defended back to the bowler
turn and bounce, played with an open face, towards short third man
flighted, defended to cover
overpitched, nearly a full toss, driven straight back to him
defended around the front leg again
pushed with an open face, wide of cover for one
nice offbreak, a little bit of drift, creating a gap between bat and pad, beats him, but the pad is covering the stumps
How did the miss the off stump? Straighter delivery, between bat and pad, but the bails are in tact. There is a woody sound, and Taibu belatedly wants to appeal, but has no support from the bowler
into the pads, helped away for one

Utseya's guile works finally. tossed up outside off again, Hansra is pulled out of the crease, and this one goes straight and beats him defensive prod, and he is stumped by a mile. Beaten in flight, beaten by the lack of turn. Stumpings don't come more comprehensive
flat delivery, defended to leg
flat on off again, hit hard to extra cover
tossed up wide outside off, draws him into a forward defensive, beats him by lack of turn, but Cheema hasn't left his crease

with one, come two! Tame dismissal. Pitched middle and off, turning away, looks to run this down to third man. However, it doesn't turn as much as he expects, takes the inside edge, onto the pad, then softly onto the stumps
nicely flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
good footwork, comes down the track and chips it towards long-on for one

whoa! Cheema has arrived. Smashed straight for a six. Just like that. Where were they hiding him? Clean and meaty, but from what I have heard Cheema is not a straight hitter, he is an unabashed across-the-line slogger
this is cross-batted. Unabashed. Slog-sweep. Four runs. Vintage Cheema
thrown up invitingly again, good bowling, Cheema keeps his cool and defends it
pushed to mid-on for one
flat, into the pads, pushed to midwicket

now we are talking, now somebody is trying to score runs. Cut away fiercely, and Coventry puts in a special effort at the boundary, diving to make a save, but his fingers were touching the rope while he did that
goes for the cut again, beaten this time

gone! Too short this eventful stay of Cheema has been. Dismissed by a juicy, leg-side full toss. Well he tried to hit a six, but was early into the shot, and off the back of the bat it lobbed straight to short fine leg. What do we look forward to now?
wide down the leg side, there have been a few of those
pushed to long-off for a single
nice offbreak, pitches middle and leg, turns away, defended
flight there, played with soft hands
short, looks to cut, but ends up playing it to extra cover
pushed through, and pushed to cover
flighted around off, pushed to long-off for one
pushed to midwicket
short to being with, cut away against the spin, but straight to cover-point
fuller, and there is dip too, and turn, hits him on the gloves, so there is bounce too
stays deep in the crease to defend it again
sharp single to square leg, appeal for run-out, but no need for third umpire
nice flighted legbreak, defended off the front foot
nice little paddle sweep, stretches well forward to take it on the full, and plays it fine
middle and leg, defended to straight midwicket
flatter, on the stumps, keeps it out
short, wide, hit-me delivery, and hit Gordon does, between cover and extra cover
another wide down the leg side
forward defensive
full, stump to stump, patted back
short again, cut away, but can't beat cover-point this time
full legbreak, pushed to cover

dropped. Would have been a classical legspinner's caught and bowled. leading edge as he looks to turn it to leg, it lobs high to Cremer's left, who goes for it, fairly simple chance, but it goes right through
pushed back to the bowler
turned away off the pads, but can't get it past short fine leg
googly there, goes deep in the crease to defend

plumb, absolutely dead plumb. This is the skiddy legbreak, and Gordon's inclination to stay back proves to be lethal this time. The ball pitches middle, rushes through and hits him in front of middle and leg
short, but it turns and gets a bit big and he has to abort the cut shot
looks to work this into the leg side, can't beat square leg
another shot played to square leg
too much turn, wide down the leg side
stretches forward to defend this
another forward-defensive
stays on the crease to keep this one out
sharp turn from leg to outside off, stays back to defend
pitches middle and off, defended
googly, beaten, big appeal for leg before from Taibu, but it pitched outside off and didn't turn in enough
legbreak again, deep in the crease
looks to drive, gets a thick outside edge towards cover
slightly short, looks to cut, is beaten
short, loose, hit back to the bowler
fuller, off and middle, defended
punched away to midwicket
another forward defensive
long hop, and pulled away to deep midwicket
full, turns away after pitching off, defended
sharp legbreak, pitching outside leg, missing off, and also the edge
goes inside out, mis-hits, but the idea is right as he is going over extra cover, and gets four runs for it
goes for the slog-sweep, but mis-hits to mid-on, along the ground
defended off the front foot this time
swept away to deep square
overpitched, driven but straight to mid-on
swept to short fine
full, pushed to long-on for one
flat, into the pads, misfield at midwicket, but Chohan is not awake to the single opportunity
defended off the front foot
looks for a sharp single, but has hit it straight to cover fielder
punched down to long-off for one
ah, good old-fashioned charge and slog, but the leading edge clears slip and falls wide of short third
forward-defensive
short and wide, and cut away handsomely for four
googly this time, stays back and defends
pushed to point
another forward defensive
almost a wicket. Looks to paddle this, gets a top edge, but it falls short of a diving Cremer at short fine leg
pushed to long-on for a single
short, cut away to sweeper-cover for one
pushed to extra cover
plays with the open face, gets a single past short third
flat and quick, played off the back foot
good drive down the ground, gets a single to long-off
stays back to defend a legbreak

straighter one or did it just not turn? It is a full delivery, he plays for the turn, and it goes straight on and hits him in front of off, it seems. Rauf upholds the appeal for leg-before. Chohan reviews this, but this is dead, hitting the inside of off stump
legbreak, on target, does well to keep his pad away and defend with the bat
slightly short with the legbreak, pushed to cover
tossed up outside off, shapes up to go for the big shot, but pulls out of it
on target right away, defended to cover
tossed up, middle and off, defended back to him
comes down the track, heaves at it, gets the inside half of the bat to long-on for one
slower through the air, turned away to square leg for one
stopped in his delivery stride. And it's a proper stop, not the half-hearted pause. Bowls full eventually for an easy single to long-on
angling into the pads, worked away for an easy single
googly, but too wide outside off to bother him
another googly, defended off the back foot
taken almost on the full, gets a single to short fine leg
lovely extra-cover drive for four runs
premeditates the paddle sweep, slip is already running to leg, but Taibu stands his ground and makes a clean collection as he is beaten outside off
beaten on the cut as this is not full enough for the shot
flat into the pads, takes a single to short fine
flighted around off, pushed to point
full, straight, blocked
short, hit back to Williams
short again, cut away to sweeper-cover for one
fired into the pads, worked away for one
full toss, hit down to long-off for one
sharp legbreak to beat him
paddled to short fine leg for one, took it on the full
punched off the back foot to extra cover
full legbreak, defended with an open face
shortish, and squeezed through to sweeper-cover for one
flat and quick, worked to leg for one
swept for one to short fine
defended off the front foot
hit back to the bowler off the back foot
straight ball, defended back to him
turn there, draws him forward, beats the edge
cut away for one
clears the front leg, then clears mid-on with the lofted hit
defended off the front foot
cut away to sweeper-cover
leading edge as he looks to turn this to leg, but it falls safe, wide of short fine
wide, almost a yorker, squeezed to short third
flattish offbreak, blocked off the front foot

that's No. 9. Good stumping off the wide down the leg side. Lamb saw him coming, bowled flat, middle and leg, and it turned down the leg side, a bit too sharply, but Taibu did well to collect it and then whip the bails off
big appeal for lbw, straighter delivery from round the stumps, close call too, no idea why they didn't go for the review there
full and fast, wide down the leg side
another big leg-before appeal, pitches middle, but perhaps didn't straighten enough
short and wide, hit powerfully, but straight to extra cover
short, into the pads, pulled away for one

bowled'im! Leggie to leggie! Through the gate. Beauty. Pitches outside off, draws the left-hand batsman into a forward defensive, then turns it between the bat and pad and takes top of off. All over at Jamtha
